results.title: A Study in choreography for camera
results.brief_description: This is the third film of the prominent American experimental film-maker, Maya Deren. It elaborates a technique developed in her previous film ‘At Land’ in which fresh contiguities of shot relations were achieved through the device of photographing a movement begun in one place, and concluding it by photographing the completion of the movement in another place, thus creating a cinematic time and place which enabled unrelated persons, place and objects to be related and brought into harmony, resulting in a new complexity of meaning and form. ‘A Study in Choreography for Camera’ features a leap by the dancer Talley Beatty, in which he begins his leap in the woods, continues it against the background of the Metropolitan Museum’s Egyptian Hall, and finishes it on the cliffs overlooking a river. Slow motion is used to prolong and dramatise the movement. John Martin, dance critic of the ‘New York Times’ called this film “virtually the beginnings of a new art, choreocinema, in which the dancer and the camera collaborate on the creation of a single new work of art.”

results.title: A Streetcar named Desire
results.creator_credit: Charles K. Feldman and Elia Kazan
results.brief_description: Blanche Dubois, a faded Southern belle whose fortunes have crumbled to nothing, comes to New Orleans to stay with her sister, Stella. Stella’s husband, the brutish but magnetic Stanley Kowalski is suspicious of her past and puts in train a devastating chain of events which will finally destroy for all time Blanche’s already tenuous grasp on the world of reality. Stars Vivien Leigh and Marlon Brando. Based on the play by Tennessee Williams. Also stars Karl Malden.

results.title: A Streetcar named desire
results.creator_credit: Keith Barish Productions, Marc Trabulus and John Erman
results.brief_description: Blanche Dubois, a faded Southern belle whose fortunes have crumbled to nothing, comes to New Orleans to stay with her sister, Stella. Stella’s husband, the brutish but magnetic Stanley Kowalski is suspicious of her past and puts in train a devastating chain of events which will finally destroy for all time Blanche’s already tenuous grasp on the world of reality. Directed by John Erman for television, this version of “A Streetcar called desire” cannot help but invite comparisons to the 1954 Vivien Leigh/Marlon Brando version directed by Elia Kazan, which is the most famous adaptation of Tennessee Williams’ play. Nonetheless the three leads - Ann-Margaret, Treat Williams, Beverly D’Angelo - make a fine job of the material in a more realistic presentation of the play which goes to great lengths to establish the physical and moral decay of New Orleans in the 1940s. Also featuring Randy Quaid.

results.title: A Street to die (AFC)
results.creator_credit: Mermaid Beach Productions, Multifilms and Bill Bennett
results.brief_description: In 1966, Col Turner was conscripted to fight in Vietnam. He served for 10 months, often in areas defoliated by toxic chemicals. In 1979 he and his wife Lorraine bought a War Service home. The street in which they lived had an unusually high incidence of psychological and family problems, birth disorders and inexplicable illness. Col contracts lymphoma which he and other Vietnam veterans believe is a direct consequence of their war service. After his death, his wife continues to seek acknowledgment by the Australian Government that his death was caused through exposure to Agent Orange. She is eventually successful and shortly after, a Senate enquiry was established, followed by a Royal Commission. Colins’ case was used as the basis of the Vietnam veterans’ claims. Starring Chris Haywood and Jennifer Cluff. Co-starring Arianthe Galani, Robin Ramsay, Peter Hehir, Peter Kowitz, Pat Evison.

results.title: A Street is witness
results.brief_description: The film includes a general history of the erection of “The Wall” separating East and West Berlin and focuses on Bernauer Strasse where the street, although part of West Berlin, contains houses down one side which belong to the Soviet sector. This street has seen many tragedies since August 13, 1961, when the wall was erected.

results.title: A Strand breaks
results.brief_description: Traces the consequences of a state of imbalance in nature. The destruction of a community as a consequence of one element getting out of hand is carefully traced in regard to both forest and grassland. The results of overgrazing and hunting are illustrated and the point made that only by intelligent management can we secure the heritage of the soil.

results.title: A Story, a story
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Kratky Film, Morton Schindel and Gail E. Hailey
results.brief_description: Nyame, the Sky God, demands a high price in exchange for his treasure. How Ananse paid the price is told in narration and woodcuts capturing the flavour of African languages, customs and lifestyles.

results.title: A Story of women = Une Affaire de femmes
results.creator_credit: MK2 Productions, Marin Karmitz and Claude Chabrol
results.brief_description:
‘Une Affaire de Femmes’ has been hailed as one of Chabrol’s finest films. Based on the true story of Marie-Louise Giraud, a wartime mother and abortionist. Since the age of fourteen, Marie has been married to Paul, and has been a devoted and dedicated wife. When Paul returns from the war, he finds that life has changed. Marie-Louise has kept the home and family together and has plenty of money from her illegal business. She decides she no longer needs or wants Paul. The film exposes hypocrisy in its political and personal manifestations. Isabelle Huppert and Francois Cluzet star in this film which won an award for Huppert at the Venice Film festival and which was voted best film at the Melbourne International Film Festival in 1989.
Cast also includes: Marie Trintignant, Nils Tavernier

results.title: A Story of sirex noctilio
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Ted Davis
results.brief_description: The wood-boring wasp sirex noctilio lays its eggs in pine sapwood and infects the tree with a destructive fungus. The pest is established in Tasmania and has been found in Victoria since 1961. Control measures are shown, such as quarantine, burning infected trees and inspection. Research is in progress on the possibility of breeding resistant strains of trees, and on biological control by imported predatory wasps.

results.title: A Story of silver
results.brief_description: Shows the place that silver has held in the past, by reference to documents and art works. Presents craftsmen of earlier times making silverware for use by churches and for the homes of great men. Demonstrates the part played by Georg Jensen, silversmithy, in the development of simpler designs more familiar today as the complex detail is omitted and the line becomes all important.
